form.official-title: To bolster certain rural broadband programs of the Department of Agriculture.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Broadband Internet Connections for Rural America Act.
Section 603(e) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950bb-2(e)) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary $300,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2029, to remain available until expended, to carry out projects in States and territories selected by the Secretary to be diverse on the basis of geography, topography, and demographics.
Not more than $25,000,000 of the amounts made available under paragraph (1) for each fiscal year may be provided for a single project.

section.header: Rural broadband program loans and grants

subsection.text: Section 601 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950bb) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the section heading, by striking Access to broadband telecommunications services in rural areas and inserting Reconnect rural broadband program;
by striking subsection (a) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: The Secretary shall establish a program, which shall be known as the ReConnect Rural Broadband Program, to provide grants, loans, and loan guarantees to finance the costs of the construction, improvement, and acquisition of facilities and equipment for broadband service in rural areas.

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)(2), by striking subparagraphs (A) and (B) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: In making grants, making loans, and guaranteeing loans under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall give the highest priority to applications for projects to provide broadband service to unserved rural communities that do not have any residential broadband service of at least—

clause.text: a 10–Mbps downstream transmission capacity; and
a 1–Mbps upstream transmission capacity.

subparagraph.text: After giving priority to the applications described in clauses (i) and (ii) of subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall then give priority to applications for projects to provide broadband service to rural communities—

clause.text: with a population of less than 10,000 inhabitants; or
with a high percentage of low income families or persons (as defined in section 501(b) of the Housing Act of 1949).
In this subparagraph, the term port means—

subclause.text: any port on the navigable waters of the United States, including territories;
any harbor, marine terminal, or other shore side facility used principally for the movement of goods on inland waters; and
any port formed in accordance with applicable State or territory law.

clause.text: In addition to the priority given under subparagraph (B), the Secretary shall give equal priority to an application for a project that would increase the availability of broadband service in a port in a rural area.

subparagraph.text: In making grants, making loans, and guaranteeing loans under this subsection, the Secretary shall consider whether an application was developed with the participation of community stakeholders, and will receive a substantial portion of the funding for the project from community stakeholders or other non-Federal sources.

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B)—

by striking the period at the end of clause (ii) and inserting ; and; and

clause.text: The Secretary shall establish an application process that permits an application for a grant-only award.

subclause.text: a single application for a grant and a loan under title I or II, or this title, that is associated with the grant; and

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this section $4,500,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2029, to remain available for 5 fiscal years after the fiscal year for which appropriated.

paragraph.text: in subsection (k), by striking 2023 and inserting 2029.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture shall promulgate rules to carry out the amendments made by subsection (a) of this section, and complete the biennial review process required by section 601(e)(2) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936.
The authorities provided by section 779 of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2018 (Public Law 115–141) shall have no force or effect after June 30, 2022.

paragraph.header: Availability of funds for administrative costs
paragraph.text: Not more than 1 percent of the unobligated balances of amounts made available as of June 1, 2021, to carry out the pilot program described in section 779 of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2018 (Public Law 115–141) may be used for the costs of transitioning from the pilot program to the program under section 601 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936, as amended by this Act.

subparagraph.text: The unobligated balances of all amounts made available on or before June 30, 2022, to carry out the pilot program described in section 779 of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2018 (Public Law 115–141) that are in excess of the amount described in subparagraph (B) of this paragraph are hereby transferred to and merged with amounts made available to carry out the program authorized under section 601 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936.

The amount described in this subparagraph is the amount required to fully fund each project approved as of June 30, 2022, under the pilot program described in such section 779 for which amounts were not obligated or partially obligated as of such date.

section.text: Section 604(g) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950bb-3(g)) is amended by striking $50,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023 and inserting $150,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2029, to remain available for 2 fiscal years after the fiscal year for which appropriated.

section.header: Distance learning and telemedicine loans and grants
section.text: Section 2335A of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 950aaa–5) is amended by striking $82,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023 and inserting $150,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2029, to remain available for 2 fiscal years after the fiscal year for which appropriated.

section.header: Expansion of middle mile infrastructure into rural areas
section.text: Section 602(g) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950bb-1(g)) is amended by striking $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2018 through 2023 and inserting $300,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2029, to remain available for 2 fiscal years after the fiscal year for which appropriated.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Agriculture shall establish a system for the dissemination of information and technical assistance on the broadband programs of the Department of Agriculture, which shall be for the use of entities eligible, such as Indian tribes and tribal organizations, to receive funds under title II or VI of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 901 et seq.) or chapter 1 of subtitle D of title XXIII of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 950aaa et seq.).

To carry out subsection (a), there are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary of Agriculture not more than $25,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2029, which are authorized to remain available through fiscal year 2029.

section.text: Section 701 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950cc) is amended by redesignating subsection (e) as subsection (f) and inserting after subsection (d) the following:

paragraph.text: The Secretary may make grants to eligible entities for the purpose of collecting broadband service data to assist the Secretary in—

subparagraph.text: establishing the availability of broadband service or middle mile infrastructure in a rural area;
determining the eligibility of a community for assistance under any broadband program administered by the Secretary; or
undertaking a service area assessment under this section.

paragraph.text: To apply for a grant under this section, an entity shall submit an application therefor which identifies—

subparagraph.text: the data collection area;
the purpose of the data collection;
the types of broadband service data to be collected;
the survey and data collection methods to be utilized; and
any other information the Secretary determines necessary to promote the integrity of broadband service data collected under this section.

paragraph.text: The amount of a grant made under this subsection shall not exceed $50,000.
The Secretary shall ensure that any broadband service data collected under this section is—

subparagraph.text: measured or assessed in accordance with such standards as the Secretary may establish;
accurate and verifiable in accordance with such standards as the Secretary may establish;
included in any broadband maps or data sets maintained by the Secretary; and

made available to the Chair of the Federal Communications Commission and the Administrator of the National Telecommunications and Information Administration for inclusion in any broadband maps or data sets either may maintain.

paragraph.text: In this subsection:

subparagraph.text: The term broadband service has the meaning given the term in section 601.

clause.text: The term broadband service data means information related to—

subclause.text: the location and type of broadband service;
the location and type of broadband infrastructure;
the advertised, maximum, and average speed of broadband service;
the average price of the most subscribed tier of broadband service;
the speed tiers of broadband service available in the area; or
any additional metric the Secretary deems appropriate.

clause.text: The Secretary shall further define the term broadband service data to ensure that data is measured and collected in a manner consistent with the reporting requirements under this section, and any broadband coordination or data- sharing obligations.

subparagraph.text: The term eligible entity means—

clause.text: a unit of local government in a rural area;
a tribal government or unit of tribal government;
an economic development or other community organization;
an eligible entity under title I or II that serves persons in rural areas;
an internet service provider that has not more than 100,000 subscribers; or
any other entity eligible under a title VI program that is not an internet service provider.

subparagraph.text: The term middle mile infrastructure has the meaning given the term in section 602.
The term rural area has the meaning given the term in section 601.

paragraph.header: Limitation on amount made available for grants
paragraph.text: The Secretary may not expend more than 1 percent of the amounts made available under subsection (f) for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2029 to carry out this subsection.

section.text: Section 701(f) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950cc(f)), as so redesignated by section 8 of this Act, is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: Not less than 3 but not more than 7 percent of the amounts appropriated to carry out title VI shall be set aside to be used—

paragraph.text: for administrative costs to carry out programs under title VI;
for technical assistance and pre-development planning activities to support the most rural communities;
to conduct oversight under title VI;
to implement accountability measures and related activities authorized under title VI; and
to carry out this section.
